com.github.cwilper.bigtrouble
Interface Connection

All Known Implementing Classes:
NodeConnection
public interface Connection

A single-threaded connection to a Cassandra node or cluster.

keyspaces

Set<String> keyspaces()
Gets all keyspace names.

Returns:
the set of names.

addKeyspace

void addKeyspace(ReplicationStrategy strategy,
                 Map<String,String> options)
Adds the keyspace.

Parameters:
strategy - the replication strategy to use.
options - the strategy-specific options to use.

deleteKeyspace

void deleteKeyspace()
Deletes the keyspace and all data within.

columnFamilies

Set<String> columnFamilies()
Gets all column family names in this keyspace.

Returns:
the set of names.

addColumnFamily

void addColumnFamily(String name,
                     String... binaryColumns)
Adds a column family. The column family will be created with a UTF8Type comparator and a default validation class of UTF8Type for new columns. Columns for which the validation class should instead be BytesType may be passed as trailing arguments to this method.

Parameters:
name - the name of the column family.
binaryColumns - the names of any columns that should have a BytesType validation class instead of the default, UTF8Type.

deleteColumnFamily

void deleteColumnFamily(String name)
Deletes a column family and all data within.

Parameters:
name - the name of the column family.

addFile

void addFile(String columnFamily,
             String key,
             InputStream in,
             Map<String,String> columns)
Adds a file.

Parameters:
columnFamily - the column family in which to store the file.
key - the unique id of the file within the column family.
in - the stream containing the content. It will be closed by the time this method returns, regardless of success or failure.
columns - zero or more name-value pairs that describe the content (may be given as null).

getFileContent

InputStream getFileContent(String columnFamily,
                           String key)
Gets the content of a file.

Parameters:
columnFamily - the column family in which it is stored.
key - the unique id of the file within the column family.
Returns:
a stream positioned at the beginning of the content, or null if the file does not exist.

deleteFile

void deleteFile(String columnFamily,
                String key)
Deletes a file.

Parameters:
columnFamily - the column family in which the file is stored.
key - the unique id of the file within the column family.

addRecord

void addRecord(String columnFamily,
               String key,
               Map<String,String> columns)
Adds a record.

Parameters:
columnFamily - the column family in which to store the record.
key - the unique id of the record within the column family.
columns - one or more name-value pairs that comprise the record.

getRecord

Map<String,String> getRecord(String columnFamily,
                             String key)
Gets a record.

Parameters:
columnFamily - the column family in which it is stored.
key - the unique id of the record within the column family.
Returns:
one or more name-value pairs that comprise the record, or null if the record does not exist.

forEachRecord

void forEachRecord(String columnFamily,
                   RecordFunction function)
Iterates records in a column family, passing each to the given function. All records will be iterated (in no particular order). The function can cause iteration to complete early by returning false.

Parameters:
columnFamily - the column family whose records should be iterated.
function - the function to execute.

deleteRecord

void deleteRecord(String columnFamily,
                  String key)
Deletes a record.

Parameters:
columnFamily - the column family in which the record is stored.
key - the unique id of the record within the column family.

exists

boolean exists(String columnFamily,
               String key)
Tells whether a record or file exists.

Parameters:
columnFamily - the column family in which to look.
key - the unique id of the record or file within the column family.
Returns:
true if it exists, false otherwise.

close

void close()
Releases any resources held by this connection.
